content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

A book in a popular book series goes on sale at time <math alttext="t equals 0"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The total number of books sold by time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> hours is modeled by the function <math alttext="B"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that satisfies the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of B, with respect to t, equals, the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator the square root of t plus 4, end root, end fraction, plus one ninth times, open parenthesis, t minus 6, close parenthesis, squared"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="B of 12, equals 36"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="B"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hundreds of books and <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 24"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="B"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></math> at <math alttext="t equals 12"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use this equation to approximate the total number of books sold by time <math alttext="t equals 10"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

A book in a popular book series goes on sale at time <math alttext="t equals 0"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The total number of books sold by time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> hours is modeled by the function <math alttext="B"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that satisfies the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of B, with respect to t, equals, the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator the square root of t plus 4, end root, end fraction, plus one ninth times, open parenthesis, t minus 6, close parenthesis, squared"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="B of 12, equals 36"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="B"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hundreds of books and <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 24"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="B"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></math> at <math alttext="t equals 12"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use this equation to approximate the total number of books sold by time <math alttext="t equals 10"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b)   Find <math alttext="B double prime of 5"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using correct units, interpret the meaning of <math alttext="B double prime of 5"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

(c)   Find an expression for <math alttext="B of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on this model, what is the total number of books sold by time <math alttext="t equals 21"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>21</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
